page.title: 12Angling Club-Castle Kennedy
page.content: The{Angling Club}was started in 1930 by Lord Stair. Lord Stair is the President of Soulseat Loch fishing and of two other lochs. Anglers can catch three different kinds of fish, perch, roach and trout.Two different kinds of trout are available. These are brown trout and rainbow trout. The session starts on the 15th. March and finishes on the 6th. October.There are several competitions including the Alf Steel Rosebowl and the annual bait competition. In 1985 there were 39 competitors for this.A water bailiff walks round Soulseat Loch to make sure no-one is fishing illegally. You can float fish and spin and use a weight to fish from the bottom. The baits most used are worms, maggots and casters. If you catch a salmon you must return it to the water.
